verses.verse: But you are to talk about things which are appropriate for sound doctrine.
The senior men are to be sober, dignified, self-controlled, being sound in faith, love, and in patience.

The senior women in the same way [are to be] in behavior what is consistent with holiness, not slanderers, not addicted to much wine, teachers of what is good, Tit 2:4 so that they teach the younger women to be clear headed, to love their husbands, to love their children,
to be self-controlled, chaste, taking care of the family, good, obedient to their own husbands, so that the Word of God is not reviled.
Likewise strongly encourage the young men to be sensible.
In everything showing yourself to be a model of good works, and in teaching [using] integrity, seriousness, incorruptibleness, [and]
sound words that can't be condemned, so that one who is an antagonistic may be ashamed, having nothing evil to say about you.
[Tell] servants to be obedient to their own masters, to be well pleasing in everything, not talking back [to them],
not stealing [from them], but demonstrating complete trustworthiness, so as to adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in everything,
for the saving grace of God has appeared to all people,
teaching us that refusing ungodliness and worldly lusts we should live in this present world with self-restraint, righteously, and pleasingly to God.
Looking for that blessed hope and glorious appearing of the great God and our Savior, Jesus Christ,
who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all lawlessness and purify for himself a special people, zealous for good works.
Talk about these things, prod and rebuke [them] with full authority. Don't let anyone despise you.
